Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant Blake A. Edwards, DOC#591742 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Blake A. Edwards, DOC#591742 is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Blake A. Edwards, DOC#591742 was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

superMiscConds.notes: 6/21/17 Court orders garnishment through DOC to be from Defendant's prison wages only. Any gifts Defendant may receive are exempt from garnishment.
To seek, obtain and maintain at least half time employment.

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!

Def is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.

Undergo sex offender treatment and follow all recommendations.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
Comply with Sex Offender Registry requirements.
Undergo STD and HIV testing and provide the results to the DA's office to share any positive results with the victim/ family of the victim. 
NO CONTACT WITH V.G. OR V.G'S RESIDENCE.
have contact with juvenile females only as prohibited by DOC. 
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
Read-in on Bayfield County case 16CF37.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

offer to settle

Defendant Blake A. Edwards in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Ct rec'd both PSI reports. No witness to be called. ADA complied with vic rights with no response. No changes to PSI for either ADA or Atty. State filed written recommendation for sentencing.  has a prior record. ADA comments protect the public, comments Def places blame on the vic. Prior history, was a family friend and repeated acts. Has taken responsibility by pleading. Atty comments has accepted responsibility for his actions, serious offense, in prison  was revoked because this case. When def was released from prison last year, his plan to return to the community was not well thought out. thinks there are other ways to handle this case then just prison. Quotes from the report on Pufall. attys response to the PSI- a different sentence the court could consider. Could go to Appleton to live with sister and participate in the program if he lived in that area. program is successful and beneficial for def.  Atty would like 10 years 4 years init and 6 imposed and stayed. 1 year condit jail time. the conditions in that states recommendation  is okay with him. Needs a plan to succeed. Def comments does know this is a serious sitn. and takes responsibility. Struggled when he was released. Ct comments potential penalty fine up to 100,000 or impre. 46 years or both such fine and imprisonment. Ct has a number of recommendations- PSI, 10-15 years init and 8 years extended. State asks for 6-8 years init and 6-8 extend supervision. Atty asking for imposed and stayed. Ct will send to prison. CT orders See offer to settle. Atty comments Readin on Byfd CO case 16CF37. Same Vic. provide JOC to byfld co DA.
Defense Response to PSI

Attorney Mark L Perrine in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def would like to be in person for SEH.....Case pending in Byfd Co (till this case complete)...VRL/complied.  DEf to appear in person.....CT PREPARE order to TRANSPORT.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2016 at 10:00 am.
ALL exhibits from 8/23/16 hearing filed in folder and placed in vault

Defendant Blake A. Edwards in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA agreement, State moves to dismiss count 1, plea to count 2, DRI count 3 ask for PSI parties free to argue. Atty Perrine comments that is agreement, states that he has agreement to DRI Bayfield County Case 16CF37. ADA comments believes that DA Bourg would dismiss in Bayfield Co. Ct comments can read in here but wants paperwork on subject. 
Ct comments maybe Atty Perrine should have discussion with defendant about 3 strikes law. Ct advises consequences of conviction (2nd strike). Def plea NC, admits repeater. Ct 1 is Dismissed, Count 3 DRI. 
Ct accepts plea and finds defendant Guilty. Ct orders PSI, file by 11/8/16
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 22, 2016 at 10:30 am.
and Certificate of Appearnce

Defendant Blake A. Edwards in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 2 motions filed, States motion in Limine, Def motion to suppress. The Court has reviewed the recording, ADA and Atty Perrine have no further evidence to present on this issue. Atty Perrine argument.  Ct finds def in custody, was given Miranda warning, finds statements voluntary, does not find violation on the part of the police. Denies motion by the defense. Moves on to the State's motion. ADA calls officer Randall, sworn exam. Cross. ADA argument. Defense argument. Ct is denying the motion in limine, does not believe it is relevent or undue prejudice. Ct comments on redacting portions of the audio recording. State withdraws motion to have audio/video recording of victim.

Defendant Blake A. Edwards in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Ruth Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense motion and State's motion. Ct starts with defense motion ADA calls Dan Pufall. sworn exam, exh 1 marked (Miranda warning form), Exh 2 marked (CD). Atty Perrine comments has not had time to prepare for his motion to be heard. Ct comments defense and states motion asks if statements can be admited, hearing will proceed.   Break recess, back on record ADA plays recording. State moves admission of exhibits, no objection, exhibits admitted.  Cross. Def would like the court to here the interview in its entirety, does not have to be at this hearing. Request granted. Exh 3 marked (def criminal record), Def stipulates to accuracy of Exh 3, Exh 3 admitted. 
ADA ref CD at 13:03. Def reserves right to make further arguement until after court has reviewed recording in entirety. Ct will review the audio and then communicate with attornies. Def to submit any additional arguement by Thurs at noon.  ADA asks for further hearing
  Hearing scheduled for August 25, 2016 at 11:00 am.
